channel.title: raspberry on Ashish's blog
channel.description: Recent content in raspberry on Ashish's blog

item.title: Installing Ubuntu 20.04 on raspberry pi for Tensorflow
item.description: Why Ubuntu - 32 bit/ 64 bit ? Out of plenty of operating systems available for raspberry pi, we need stable one’s intended to run ml projects (tf-lite, opencv). Raspberry Pi group’s debian based raspbian os provide good support and stable, but it is 32 bit. There is a 64 bit version out but in beta stage. We need a 64 bit OS for increased performance. Ubuntu provides OS in 64 bit version for rpi.
